p.a: SCES, located in Wyoming, IL, serves children from preschool through 5th grade.
SCJH located in Toulon, IL, serves children from 6th through 8th grade.
SCHS located in Toulon, IL, serves children from 9th through 12th grade.
Stark County CUSD #100 is 242 square miles
Student to teacher ratio at Stark County Elementary is 15:1

div.p: 4/15/20 – Parents – Please complete this survey for each of your students on our current eLearning effort >> SURVEY LINK
3/21/20 “All of our schools and playgrounds are closed, but personnel will be remotely checking for voicemails if you need to reach staff.”
For technical issues with student Chromebooks, contact Mr. Heinold at IT@stark100.com

p.a: 3/13/20 Letter to students, staff, and community.

h3.span: Our architect recently presented the School Board with three design proposals to upgrade the Toulon campus. Click this link to see the designs. Master Plan for Toulon Campus

div.p: Our district is made up of 727 attending three schools Stark County Elementary, Stark County Junior High and Stark County High School.

div.class: cff-item cff-photo-post cff-box cff-shadow author-stark-county-cusd-100 cff-322676618110440 cff-new

p.span:
Jr. High Announcements
Thursday, April 23, 2020 – A Day
E Learning – Today is a A Day, Chorus and for Art & Current Event classes
Packet pick up/drop off Today, Thursday, April 23rd - We will again be having pick up and drop off this Thursday from 2-6pm in the HS foyer (outside the gym). We will accept packets from all three buildings: elementary, junior high, and high school. Teachers will email your student if there is a packet to be picked up
Clear Your Browser – Students are having problems with things loading or being able to access google classroom pages so I have added steps at the bottom to clear your data. If this doesn’t work you can email your teacher or Mr. Heinold - dheinold@stark100.com
Attendance – Make sure your student is checking with their teachers through google classroom. That is how we are tracking attendance. If you are having trouble with your chromebook, please call the office so you are not counted absent for the day.
Math, Stoner/Conrad – Make sure there is communication with the math teacher for each completed box on your grids for math.
2020-2021 Registration –Registration information has been mailed. Again, as last year, you will be able to register online. You were mailed an information sheet, fee form, Blackboard instructions to update Alert Call numbers & supply list.
Meal prices for next year were approved as follow; Lunch - $2.65 and Breakfast - $1.20
Keep checking the Stark County CUSD 100 Facebook page for updates and thank you, parents, for your patience and understanding.
IF YOU DON’T HAVE INTERNET - Students are welcome to go to the Elem and JH parking lots to use the school wifi. Students then can download to their chromebooks the lessons to work on at home without even getting out of your comfortable car!

img.alt:
Jr. High Announcements Thursday, April 23, 2020 – A Day E Learning – Today is a A Day, Chorus and for Art & Current Event classes
Packet pick up/drop off Today, Thursday, April 23rd - We will again be having pick up and drop off this Thursday from 2-6pm in the HS foyer (outside the gym). We will accept packets from all three buildings: elementary, junior high, and high school. Teachers will email your student if there is a packet to be picked up
Clear Your Browser – Students are having problems with things loading or being able to access google classroom pages so I have added steps at the bottom to clear your data. If this doesn’t work you can email your teacher or Mr. Heinold - dheinold@stark100.com
Attendance – Make sure your student is checking with their teachers through google classroom. That is how we are tracking attendance. If you are having trouble with your chromebook, please call the office so you are not counted absent for the day.
Math, Stoner/Conrad – Make sure there is communication with the math teacher for each completed box on your grids for math.
2020-2021 Registration –Registration information has been mailed. Again, as last year, you will be able to register online. You were mailed an information sheet, fee form, Blackboard instructions to update Alert Call numbers & supply list. Meal prices for next year were approved as follow; Lunch - $2.65 and Breakfast - $1.20
Keep checking the Stark County CUSD 100 Facebook page for updates and thank you, parents, for your patience and understanding. IF YOU DON’T HAVE INTERNET - Students are welcome to go to the Elem and JH parking lots to use the school wifi. Students then can download to their chromebooks the lessons to work on at home without even getting out of your comfortable car!

div.p: I like your "Deep breath and I can do this". You are the definition of calm Mrs. Bibb 🙂 And, New Coke was pretty awful.
Aidan says he likes to say, "Stop. Calm down."

div.class: cff-item cff-photo-post cff-box cff-shadow author-stark-county-cusd-100 cff-322676618110440 cff-new

p.span:
SCHS is proud to introduce our new Industrial Tech teacher for the 2020/21 school year, Skyler Anderson.
Hello! My name is Skyler Anderson and I am very excited to be joining the Stark County High School team! I've been working in the woodworking industry for ten years. I got my start attending a school in Michigan learning how to build guitars. From there, I have lived in Austin, Texas working on custom built guitars and vintage repairs, moved back to Peoria where I became a Journeyman Cabinet Maker, training other new cabinet makers along the way, became interested in fine furniture-making, and now I get to teach Industrial Arts!
I grew up in Metamora and spent my high school career heavily involved with the school band playing saxophone. I still play my tenor sax to this day! I play drums, synth, and saxophone in a rock band in the Peoria area. I'm also a big enthusiast of the outdoors. I love to fish, hike, and cycle. In fact, I rode my bike 340 miles across Missouri last year over the course of a week and camped every night. It was a really great adventure and I can't wait to plan my next trip.
I hope to pass on my love of woodworking and other skilled trades to my students. Being able to learn a skill and apply it to life, whether it be for a career, hobby, or necessity is in my opinion, incredibly valuable. I look forward to meeting you all at the start of the new school year!

img.alt:
SCHS is proud to introduce our new Industrial Tech teacher for the 2020/21 school year, Skyler Anderson.
Hello! My name is Skyler Anderson and I am very excited to be joining the Stark County High School team! Ive been working in the woodworking industry for ten years. I got my start attending a school in Michigan learning how to build guitars. From there, I have lived in Austin, Texas working on custom built guitars and vintage repairs, moved back to Peoria where I became a Journeyman Cabinet Maker, training other new cabinet makers along the way, became interested in fine furniture-making, and now I get to teach Industrial Arts!
I grew up in Metamora and spent my high school career heavily involved with the school band playing saxophone. I still play my tenor sax to this day! I play drums, synth, and saxophone in a rock band in the Peoria area. Im also a big enthusiast of the outdoors. I love to fish, hike, and cycle. In fact, I rode my bike 340 miles across Missouri last year over the course of a week and camped every night. It was a really great adventure and I cant wait to plan my next trip.
I hope to pass on my love of woodworking and other skilled trades to my students. Being able to learn a skill and apply it to life, whether it be for a career, hobby, or necessity is in my opinion, incredibly valuable. I look forward to meeting you all at the start of the new school year!

div.p: Those are some very cool experiences you’re bringing to Stark County! Congratulations and good luck! 😀
Best of luck in your new position at Stark County!
Happy to have you here, Skylar! Welcome!
Skyler you’re teaching where I went to high school!!!! You’ll be like less than a block from my family home!
This is so cool, wonderful, and perfect! So proud of you and happy for you! The kids will love you! 💕

div.class: cff-item cff-video-post cff-status-post cff-box cff-shadow author-stark-county-cusd-100 cff-322676618110440 cff-new
